analyzed: rig byed yan lag bcas pa bslabs //

analyzed: bla ma'i bka' yi rjes gnang thob //

original: sa m'a britta zhes pa'o //
analyzed: sa m'a britta zhes pa'o //

analyzed: cig shos tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod //
translated: [He was] the other who practiced with a celestial consort.🔽[He was] Sātithyā, the single guru.

analyzed: sa t'irthy'a ni bla ma gcig / pra bam aanda b'a da ni // mi ldan sbyin sreg mkhan du 'gyur //

original: bsags ldan me ni aidha cir //
analyzed: bsags ldan me ni aidha cir //
translated: [He was] the one with a wife, the fire-worshipper.

original: brgyud pa'i man ngag aee ti ksham //
analyzed: brgyud pa'i man ngag aee ti ksham //
translated: [He was] the one with the lineage instruction, Aitikṣma.

original: bla ma brgyud pa'i rim pa yis //
analyzed: bla ma brgyud pa'i rim pa yis //

original: man ngag yang dag rab sbyin pa //🔽nye bar shes dad dang por shes //
analyzed: man ngag yang dag rab sbyin pa // nye bar shes dad dang por shes //

original: shes nas rtsom pa nye ba'i rim //
analyzed: shes nas rtsom pa nye ba'i rim //
translated: [He was] the one who, knowing, undertakes, the one who is close.

original: mchod sbyin gyis sreg aa dhva da //
analyzed: mchod sbyin gyis sreg aa dhva da //

original: mchod sbyin dang ni rgyud bdun pa //
analyzed: mchod sbyin dang ni rgyud bdun pa //

original: ma kha tra tu sam sta ra //
analyzed: ma kha tra tu sam sta ra //

original: gral dang / rgyun dang / thos pa'i las //
analyzed: gral dang / rgyun dang / thos pa'i las //
translated: [He was] the one with the row, the one with the stream, the one with the hearing action.

original: bde ba'i chu dang / bla re'o /
analyzed: bde ba'i chu dang / bla re'o /
translated: [He was] the one with the water of happiness, the one with the canopy.

original: 13 / rgyal po'i mchod sbyin bcos pa dang // mi yi bdag po'i aa dha ra //🔽'don dang sbyin sreg mgron 'ongs mchod //
analyzed: 13 / rgyal po'i mchod sbyin bcos pa dang // mi yi bdag po'i aa dha ra // 'don dang sbyin sreg mgron 'ongs mchod //
translated: The king's sacrifice is the rite; the lord of men's is the adhara.

original: mtshun gsol ba dang gtor ma ste //
analyzed: mtshun gsol ba dang gtor ma ste //
translated: The guest's is the oblation; the ancestor's, the offering.

original: 'di rnams mchod sbyin chen po lnga //🔽tshangs pa'i mchod sbyin klog 'don pa //
analyzed: 'di rnams mchod sbyin chen po lnga // tshangs pa'i mchod sbyin klog 'don pa //

original: lha yi mchod sbyin sbyin sreg yin //🔽mi yi mchod sbyin mgron 'ongs mchod //
analyzed: lha yi mchod sbyin sbyin sreg yin // mi yi mchod sbyin mgron 'ongs mchod //

original: pha mes mchod sbyin mtshun tshim byed //
analyzed: pha mes mchod sbyin mtshun tshim byed //
translated: The human's is the guest's offering; the ancestor's, the satisfaction of the ancestors.

original: 'byung po'i mchod sbyin gtor mar brjod //
analyzed: 'byung po'i mchod sbyin gtor mar brjod //

original: 'khor dang yongs bskor tshogs pa 'du //
analyzed: 'khor dang yongs bskor tshogs pa 'du //

original: sa mi ti dang si pa dang // sa mi ti dang sam mi dzya //
analyzed: sa mi ti dang si pa dang // sa mi ti dang sam mi dzya //

original: kun tu gnas dang sa rda dang // na na dang ni 'dus pa'o /
analyzed: kun tu gnas dang sa rda dang // na na dang ni 'dus pa'o /

original: 12 / khyim dang dang po'i rgyud dang ni //
analyzed: 12 / khyim dang dang po'i rgyud dang ni //

analyzed: dang po / sbyin sreg 'dus pa dang // 'phral 'dus pa dang / t'a ra dang // sa bh'a sad / rab tu bsten //

original: 'dus dang cho ga blta ba'o //
analyzed: 'dus dang cho ga blta ba'o //

original: sdeb sbyor shes dang thos ldan mtshungs //
analyzed: sdeb sbyor shes dang thos ldan mtshungs //

original: shoo ti / shro ti ya t'a'o //
analyzed: shoo ti / shro ti ya t'a'o //

original: rigs tsam dang ni nyer 'tsho gang //
analyzed: rigs tsam dang ni nyer 'tsho gang //

original: de ni bram zer 'gyur bar bshad //
analyzed: de ni bram zer 'gyur bar bshad //

original: aa dhva s'ud dang / bhra hri dang // sbyin sreg byed po mchod sbyin dang // snyan tshig rig byed rim pa las //
analyzed: aa dhva s'ud dang / bhra hri dang // sbyin sreg byed po mchod sbyin dang // snyan tshig rig byed rim pa las //

analyzed: aa gn'i dhi sogs las phyi rol // dus mchod rig byed spyod byed pa //

original: mchod sbyin zla ba'i bgrod pa dang // dbang po'i brtul zhugs mtshungs pa'o //
analyzed: mchod sbyin zla ba'i bgrod pa dang // dbang po'i brtul zhugs mtshungs pa'o //

analyzed: @132b de ni sam st'a pa'i mchod sbyin //

original: bstod pa'i sa gzhi skye bos dben //
analyzed: bstod pa'i sa gzhi skye bos dben //

original: rig byed sa gzhi yongs su sbyangs //
analyzed: rig byed sa gzhi yongs su sbyangs //

original: thang mnyam pa dang bzhi mdo'o //
analyzed: thang mnyam pa dang bzhi mdo'o //
translated: are the four.

original: sbyin sreg thab la ta ra ni //
analyzed: sbyin sreg thab la ta ra ni //

original: ma h'a r'i ro me ma kha' //
analyzed: ma h'a r'i ro me ma kha' //
translated: the great fire is the mahārī,

original: sbyin sreg du ba nges tshigs so //
analyzed: sbyin sreg du ba nges tshigs so //
translated: the smoke of the fire offering is the sign,

original: sbyin sreg thal ba beshta tam //
analyzed: sbyin sreg thal ba beshta tam //
translated: the ashes of the fire offering are the viṣṭa.🔽The sacrificial post is the caṣāla,

original: phyugs btags srog shing tsa sh'a la //
analyzed: phyugs btags srog shing tsa sh'a la //

original: bum pa shin tu bskor ba'i khyim //
analyzed: bum pa shin tu bskor ba'i khyim //

original: srog shing rtse mo ta rma'o //
analyzed: srog shing rtse mo ta rma'o //
translated: The top of the life-tree is the tamarind.

original: rtsub shing rtsub stan aa ra ni //
analyzed: rtsub shing rtsub stan aa ra ni //
translated: The rough wood and the rough seat are the arani.

original: lho yi me dang / khyim gyi me //
analyzed: lho yi me dang / khyim gyi me //

original: ha ba ni ste me gsum mo //
analyzed: ha ba ni ste me gsum mo //
translated: are the havana, the three fires.

original: me 'di gsum la te ta'o //
analyzed: me 'di gsum la te ta'o //

original: dri na ta ni legs sbyangs me //
analyzed: dri na ta ni legs sbyangs me //

original: sa mri ksham ni yongs su spyod //
analyzed: sa mri ksham ni yongs su spyod //

original: nyer sbyod me ni rab tu sbyor //
analyzed: nyer sbyod me ni rab tu sbyor //

original: gang zhig khyim bdag d'a n'i ma //
analyzed: gang zhig khyim bdag d'a n'i ma //
translated: The one who is the householder Dhana's

original: lho phyogs me ni pra ni ya //
analyzed: lho phyogs me ni pra ni ya //
translated: southern fire is the praniya.

original: de ni a'a la syar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni a'a la syar 'gyur ro //

original: de nas sdeb sbyor g'a ya tr'i //
analyzed: de nas sdeb sbyor g'a ya tr'i //
translated: Then the meter is gayatri.

original: ausht'i ka la sogs kyang ngo //
analyzed: ausht'i ka la sogs kyang ngo //
translated: The uṣṇik and so forth are also so.🔽The fuel and the offering materials expressed by that

analyzed: des brjod yam shing sreg rdzas dang // de ni me yi gter du brjod //

original: aa mi ksh'a s'a pri to shti //
analyzed: aa mi ksh'a s'a pri to shti //
translated: The amikṣā is the priti.

original: 'o ma zho dang sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: 'o ma zho dang sbyar ba'o //

original: sreg rdzas smin pa tsa tu te //
analyzed: sreg rdzas smin pa tsa tu te //

original: zas mchog dang ni 'o thug go / ha bya lha zas 'o ma can //
analyzed: zas mchog dang ni 'o thug go / ha bya lha zas 'o ma can //

original: ka bya mtshun gsol zas yin no //
analyzed: ka bya mtshun gsol zas yin no //

original: de dag 'o ma ldan pa la //🔽s'u sha byin s'u sha can //
analyzed: de dag 'o ma ldan pa la // s'u sha byin s'u sha can //

original: rlung yab dang ni bsil yab ni //
analyzed: rlung yab dang ni bsil yab ni //

original: ri dvags pags pa las byas pa'o //
analyzed: ri dvags pags pa las byas pa'o //

original: au pa kri ta dud 'gro ni //
analyzed: au pa kri ta dud 'gro ni //
translated: The spoon is used for the clarified butter.🔽The animal is called upakṛta.

original: mchod sbyin ched du gsod par btags //
analyzed: mchod sbyin ched du gsod par btags //

original: phan tshun zhing dang gsang gtor byas //
analyzed: phan tshun zhing dang gsang gtor byas //

original: gsod pa'i tshad kyi phyugs yin no //
analyzed: gsod pa'i tshad kyi phyugs yin no //

original: brjod bya'i rtags can pra m'i ta //
analyzed: brjod bya'i rtags can pra m'i ta //

original: bsnyen rdzogs 'thor 'thung byas nas gsod //
analyzed: bsnyen rdzogs 'thor 'thung byas nas gsod //

original: sreg rdzas sbyin sreg sbyin byas pa //
analyzed: sreg rdzas sbyin sreg sbyin byas pa //

original: zas ldan pa sha ta byas pa'o //
analyzed: zas ldan pa sha ta byas pa'o //

original: de gnyis gcig ste mchod sbyin lha //
analyzed: de gnyis gcig ste mchod sbyin lha //
translated: Those two are the same. The god of sacrifice.

original: sbyin sreg rdzas b'anna mm'a //
analyzed: sbyin sreg rdzas b'anna mm'a //

original: de nas thub pa smra ba bcad //
analyzed: de nas thub pa smra ba bcad //

original: diksh'i mtha' can mchod sbyin gtso //
analyzed: diksh'i mtha' can mchod sbyin gtso //

analyzed: de dag gsod las byed ya dznyi yam //

analyzed: gtor ma 'bul ba sbyin ba dang // nye bar 'gyed dang rnam par gtong //

analyzed: rnam byin brims dang rnam par bkram // so sor byin dang mngon du bstan //

analyzed: pha mes bya ba brgyad pa dang // nyin mo'i cha dang ku ta pa //
translated: The one who desires the sacrifice (purta) is the one who desires the sacrifice.🔽 The one who desires the sacrifice

original: dus ston zla dus mchod pa'o //
analyzed: dus ston zla dus mchod pa'o //
translated: The festival, the month, the worship.🔽The door of the gods, the divine abode,

analyzed: lha yi sgo dang lha'i ltang mo ; / gyad kyi ltad mo ma h'um ri //

analyzed: ko shal can yun ring dang // 'don pa po dang chos smra ba //
translated: The reciter, the one who expounds the Dharma,🔽The one who has come forth, the guest,

analyzed: mngon par 'ongs dang mgron 'ongs dang // rab 'joms 'joms dang bi shi ka' //

original: sha kunda skyes dooshmanta //
analyzed: sha kunda skyes dooshmanta //

original: yang yang 'gro dang yong ba can //
analyzed: yang yang 'gro dang yong ba can //

analyzed: srid sgrub lus skyes gcod byed dang // brtson 'grus ldan dang 'byung po'i steng //

original: 'dam bu dang ni /
analyzed: 'dam bu dang ni /

original: nee sha dha //🔽bsod nams grags ldan rab dang ldan //
analyzed: nee sha dha // bsod nams grags ldan rab dang ldan //
translated: and Neishé.🔽Sonam Drakden, Rabden,🔽Thönden, Shipa, Jikchen,

analyzed: thos ldan zhi pa 'jigs chen dang // pra bhi ya dang dga' ba'o //

original: bu mo yo dza na ganna //
analyzed: bu mo yo dza na ganna //
translated: Bumo, Yözana Nén,

analyzed: g'i ge y'i dang bde ldan ma // rnam pa kra brtson 'grus lus bkra skyes //
translated: Gegeya, and Denma,🔽Nampa, Tra, and Tsül Kye,

original: nag mo aa sho da ri' dang // gann ba ti rgyas ba'i ma //
analyzed: nag mo aa sho da ri' dang // gann ba ti rgyas ba'i ma //
translated: Nakmo, Ashodari,🔽Nénba, Ti, and Gyepa,

original: gam g'a skyes dang ga g'a ma //
analyzed: gam g'a skyes dang ga g'a ma //
translated: Ganga, and Gama.

original: bu ni lha yi brtul zhugs dang // zhi ba gsar dang gangga'i bu //
analyzed: bu ni lha yi brtul zhugs dang // zhi ba gsar dang gangga'i bu //
translated: Santi, Navaratha, Gangavat,🔽Gangaja, Bhaya, Nidhi, Mleccha, Yama,

original: gangg'a skyes dang 'jigs pa dang // mjod gnas kla klo 'chi bdag dang // grong gi nor zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gangg'a skyes dang 'jigs pa dang // mjod gnas kla klo 'chi bdag dang // grong gi nor zhes bya ba'o //
translated: and Grha-dhana.

original: yul 'khor srung gi ma las skyes //🔽she rab mig dang ma can bu //
analyzed: yul 'khor srung gi ma las skyes // she rab mig dang ma can bu //
translated: The son of Dhritarashtra is Vikarna.🔽The son of Vidura is Prajñâkṣa.

original: skya ba'o m'i di so so yi //
analyzed: skya ba'o m'i di so so yi //
translated: The sons of Śakuni are

original: k'anta kundi 'di dag mtshungs //🔽aa mr'a li ka las skyes pa //
analyzed: k'anta kundi 'di dag mtshungs // aa mr'a li ka las skyes pa //
translated: Kaṇṭhaka and Kundaka.🔽The son of Aśmaka is

original: bindha ba dang aa mra'i bu //
analyzed: bindha ba dang aa mra'i bu //
translated: Vindhya and Āmalaka.

original: 'thab dka'i dgra dan rgyal po ste //
analyzed: 'thab dka'i dgra dan rgyal po ste //
translated: The son of Duryodhana is Durmukha,

original: g'anna ra skyes 'thab pa med //🔽chos rgyal skyes ni m'i dhi ste //
analyzed: g'anna ra skyes 'thab pa med // chos rgyal skyes ni m'i dhi ste //
translated: and the son of Gāṇḍīra is Durjaya.🔽The son of Dharmaraja is Yudhisthira,

original: chos kyi bu ni dka' thub bu //🔽ki ka rnams ni rjes su skyes //
analyzed: chos kyi bu ni dka' thub bu // ki ka rnams ni rjes su skyes //
translated: and the son of Dharma is Tapasvi.🔽The sons of Vidura are

original: ma skyes dgra ni g-yul ngor brtan //🔽bri ko da ri 'jigs sde'o //
analyzed: ma skyes dgra ni g-yul ngor brtan // bri ko da ri 'jigs sde'o //
translated: Aśvatthāmā, Śalya, and others.🔽The son of Bṛhadratha is Śatrujit,

original: dpa' bo'i rdul dang ka ta'i rma //🔽tshogs skyes klu yi stobs zhes bya //
analyzed: dpa' bo'i rdul dang ka ta'i rma // tshogs skyes klu yi stobs zhes bya //
translated: and the son of Śūra is Pāṇḍu.

original: rlung gi bu ni di rma bhi t'a //
analyzed: rlung gi bu ni di rma bhi t'a //
translated: The son of Vāyu is Bhima,

original: ba ka kin'i karm'i ra //
analyzed: ba ka kin'i karm'i ra //
translated: and the son of Paka is Kṛṣṇa.

original: dza r'i sbrang rtsi 'joms pa'o //
analyzed: dza r'i sbrang rtsi 'joms pa'o //
translated: Jari is the destroyer of honey.

original: aa rdzu nal bu ram kra //
analyzed: aa rdzu nal bu ram kra //
translated: Arjuna is sugarcane.

original: stobs bzang dbang dang 'dam pa che //
analyzed: stobs bzang dbang dang 'dam pa che //
translated: Bala is power, and mahat is great.

original: y'anna cod pan g'andi //
analyzed: y'anna cod pan g'andi //
translated: Yajna is the head, and gandhi is the sacrificial post.

original: snying po med dang brgya byin dga' //
analyzed: snying po med dang brgya byin dga' //
translated: Asat is worthless, and indra is Indra.

original: 'jigs rung rnam rgyal rgyal byed dang // ma bya p'a ts'a dha na gang //
analyzed: 'jigs rung rnam rgyal rgyal byed dang // ma bya p'a ts'a dha na gang //
translated: Bhiru is fearful, vijaya is victory, and jaya is the victor.🔽Apa is water, and dhana is wealth.

original: gzhon pa dkar po b'irtta gho //
analyzed: gzhon pa dkar po b'irtta gho //
translated: Yuvati is a young woman, shukla is white, and vritta is conduct.

original: gsang ba'i rab dbye ka bi skyes //
analyzed: gsang ba'i rab dbye ka bi skyes //
translated: Guhya is secret, and vibhajya is divided.

original: dga' ba'i dbyangs 'gyur g'and'a bi //
analyzed: dga' ba'i dbyangs 'gyur g'and'a bi //
translated: Gandi is a musical instrument, and abhi is a sound.

original: gandi bi dang dha nu'o //
analyzed: gandi bi dang dha nu'o //
translated: Gandivi is a bow, and dhanur is an arrow.

original: troo ba d'i dang ri skyes ma //
analyzed: troo ba d'i dang ri skyes ma //
translated: Troavati is a river, and ja is a woman.

original: nag @136b mo lnga len ma skye'o //🔽skyed ma bsod nams grags ldan ma //
analyzed: nag @136b mo lnga len ma skye'o // skyed ma bsod nams grags ldan ma //
translated: Krishna is black, and pancalika is born.🔽Janani is a mother, and punyasri is famous.

original: mchog sbyin 'dren ma rig byed skyes //
analyzed: mchog sbyin 'dren ma rig byed skyes //
translated: Varada is a giver of boons, and veda is born.

original: rtag tu lang tsho ldan ma'o //🔽kra ya stobs bzang ma gnyis ma //
analyzed: rtag tu lang tsho ldan ma'o // kra ya stobs bzang ma gnyis ma //
translated: Taruni is always youthful.🔽Krava is strength, and bala is a good man.

original: srid sgrub ma dang lus ldan ma //
analyzed: srid sgrub ma dang lus ldan ma //
translated: Arjuna is a hero, and dehin is a body.

original: rigs med dang ni lhar bcas kyi //
analyzed: rigs med dang ni lhar bcas kyi //
translated: Asat is non-existent, and sahasra is a thousand.

original: ma las skyes pa skye dgu skyes //
analyzed: ma las skyes pa skye dgu skyes //
translated: Jana is a people, and janani is a mother.

original: sa'i rna ba la aangga'i rgyal //
analyzed: sa'i rna ba la aangga'i rgyal //
translated: Anga is a part, and kshetra is the earth.

original: r'a dhar skyes dang 'joms byed bu //
analyzed: r'a dhar skyes dang 'joms byed bu //
translated: Rādhara, and Jāmarī,

original: nyi ma dga' ba rnams yin no //
analyzed: nyi ma dga' ba rnams yin no //
translated: and Sūryapriya.🔽In the Kumbhīpakṣa, Antaka, Kāla, and Kālapāśa,

original: bum pa can la mthar byed dang // dus kyi phyi ma mun dbang phyug / nag mo skyes dang sde bzang dang // bkra ba'i sa dang gcod byed do /
analyzed: bum pa can la mthar byed dang // dus kyi phyi ma mun dbang phyug / nag mo skyes dang sde bzang dang // bkra ba'i sa dang gcod byed do /
translated: Kṛṣṇa, Śreṇi, Citra, and Chedana.🔽In the Bhādrapada, Srotā, Bhāradvāja,

original: bre bo che la rgyun gyi bdag / bh'a ra dhva dza'i slob dpon dang // chu yi bdag dang bla ma'o //
analyzed: bre bo che la rgyun gyi bdag / bh'a ra dhva dza'i slob dpon dang // chu yi bdag dang bla ma'o //
translated: and Āpa, and Guru.

original: bre bo che'i bu chu yi bu //
analyzed: bre bo che'i bu chu yi bu //
translated: The son of Bhādrapada, and Āpa,

original: skye bo mgul dang drang srong rgyal //
analyzed: skye bo mgul dang drang srong rgyal //
translated: and Jālin, and Ṛṣivṛṣa,

original: yongs su 'phangs pa'i bu yang ngo //
analyzed: yongs su 'phangs pa'i bu yang ngo //
translated: and Parivṛṣa.🔽In the Āśvayuja, Jārakurubha,

original: dza ra ku ru 'gro byed mchog / ba the ta sya tshes bcas ma //
analyzed: dza ra ku ru 'gro byed mchog / ba the ta sya tshes bcas ma //
translated: and Vāta, and Tithi,

original: dza ta ko ru ma na ma' //
analyzed: dza ta ko ru ma na ma' //
translated: and Jātakurubha.🔽In the Kārttika, Devī, and Etad,🔽and Āvasika, and Manu, and Śarīreśa,

original: lha mo zhes dang ae ta dag / gnas pa can mi dang lus bdag dang // rnam snang bu dang stobs ldan dang // mngal can binda ba li'i bu //
analyzed: lha mo zhes dang ae ta dag / gnas pa can mi dang lus bdag dang // rnam snang bu dang stobs ldan dang // mngal can binda ba li'i bu //
translated: and Vairocana, and Balin, and Garbhin, and Vindavalī.🔽In the Mārgaśiras, Aśani, and Bṛhat,

original: mtshon cha can dang bri to pa //
analyzed: mtshon cha can dang bri to pa //
translated: and Bṛhatphala, and Bṛhat.

original: 'dul dbyangs dang bu mchod rten dang // byis ba skyong dang tsi r'i ra //
analyzed: 'dul dbyangs dang bu mchod rten dang // byis ba skyong dang tsi r'i ra //
translated: Vināyaka, Kūṭadāgāya, Bālakrīḍa, Cīrāya,

original: shing rta che'i bu mkhar ba dang // dza ra sa tya bde mchog skyes //🔽rna ba can dang rtsa ba'i lha //
analyzed: shing rta che'i bu mkhar ba dang // dza ra sa tya bde mchog skyes // rna ba can dang rtsa ba'i lha //
translated: Mahāratha, Kumbhīra, Jātisattva, and Sukṛta.🔽Karṇa, Mūladeva,

original: rtsa ba bzang dang myu gu'i cha'o //🔽bka' dbang gros pa blon po dang // gros kyi snod dang gzhung lugs 'dzin //
analyzed: rtsa ba bzang dang myu gu'i cha'o // bka' dbang gros pa blon po dang // gros kyi snod dang gzhung lugs 'dzin //
translated: Mūlasundara, and Aṅkura.🔽Ājñā, Saṃmata, Mantri, and Mantriṇī,

original: blo dang bzod pa can zhes pa //
analyzed: blo dang bzod pa can zhes pa //
translated: Dhāraṇī, and Āgamavratī.

original: gzhan ni las dang lhan cig spyod //
analyzed: gzhan ni las dang lhan cig spyod //
translated: The others are together with Karma.🔽Mahācārya, Pradhāna,

original: slob dpon chen po gtso bo dang // slob dpon chen po mdun na 'don //🔽bde legs can dang lta thog pa //
analyzed: slob dpon chen po gtso bo dang // slob dpon chen po mdun na 'don // bde legs can dang lta thog pa //
translated: Mahācārya, and Pūrṇagiri,🔽Kṣemaṅkara, and Dṛṣṭitīrtha,

original: gnyer pa dang ni spyan gzigs pa //
analyzed: gnyer pa dang ni spyan gzigs pa //
translated: Adhikṛta, and Avalokita,🔽Netradharma, and Avalokita,

original: mig gi chos can spyan pa dang // rtog dang rtog par byed pa po //🔽tha snyad rnams la blta ba'o //🔽sgo srung ba dang sgo skyong ba //
analyzed: mig gi chos can spyan pa dang // rtog dang rtog par byed pa po // tha snyad rnams la blta ba'o // sgo srung ba dang sgo skyong ba //
translated: Kalpa, and Kalpayitāra,🔽and Vyavahāra.🔽Dvārapāla, and Dvāriṇī,

original: sgor gnas sgo ldan dbyug pa can //
analyzed: sgor gnas sgo ldan dbyug pa can //
translated: Dvāreśvara, and Daṇḍī,

original: sgor gnas pa la blta ba'o //
analyzed: sgor gnas pa la blta ba'o //
translated: and Dvāreśvara.

original: pra t'i h'ar++ya nyer gnas blta //
analyzed: pra t'i h'ar++ya nyer gnas blta //
translated: Praty-aharya, the one who is to be looked at by the upasakas.

original: de ni be ta byed pa dang // pe ta 'dzin dang to da ka / log sgrub skyes dang 'jug byed pa //
analyzed: de ni be ta byed pa dang // pe ta 'dzin dang to da ka / log sgrub skyes dang 'jug byed pa //
translated: He is the one who does the Veda, the one who holds the Veda, the one who is a todakaka, the one who is born of a false practice, the one who is engaged,

original: snyems tshogs can dang dpya yi gnas //
analyzed: snyems tshogs can dang dpya yi gnas //
translated: the one who is a group of the proud, the one who is a tax-payer,

original: mkhar can dang ni rdzong skyong ba //
analyzed: mkhar can dang ni rdzong skyong ba //
translated: the one who is a fort-holder, the one who is a fort-protector,

original: dus bu skyong dang dum bu can //
analyzed: dus bu skyong dang dum bu can //
translated: the one who is a son-protector, the one who is a part-holder,

original: srung @137a * //
analyzed: srung @137a * //
translated: the one who is a protector,

original: ma'i tshogs pa sku srungs pa //
analyzed: ma'i tshogs pa sku srungs pa //
translated: the one who is a group of protectors, the one who is a protector of the body,

original: be ta'i sde dang bsrung ba'o //
analyzed: be ta'i sde dang bsrung ba'o //
translated: the one who is a group of the Veda, the one who is a protector.

original: gnas brtan dang ni grong dpon dang // gzhis pa dag gnyer ba hu ri pa //
analyzed: gnas brtan dang ni grong dpon dang // gzhis pa dag gnyer ba hu ri pa //
translated: The sthavira, the one who is a head of the village, the one who is a householder, the one who is a manager, the one who is a hurīpa,🔽the one who is an inner palace-man, the one who is an inner person,

original: pho brang nang pa nang mi dang // nang na gnas pa'i skye bo'o //🔽gser mdzod pa dang / gser gnyer pa //
analyzed: pho brang nang pa nang mi dang // nang na gnas pa'i skye bo'o // gser mdzod pa dang / gser gnyer pa //
translated: the one who is an inner resident.🔽The one who is a gold-treasurer, the one who is a gold-manager,

original: dngul mdzod pa dang 'dul gnyer ba //
analyzed: dngul mdzod pa dang 'dul gnyer ba //
translated: the one who is a silver-treasurer, the one who is a disciplinarian,

original: grong gnas pa dang gnas byed pa //
analyzed: grong gnas pa dang gnas byed pa //
translated: the one who is a town-dweller, the one who is a resident,

original: spyan pa de nas sa bi ba //
analyzed: spyan pa de nas sa bi ba //
translated: the one who is a spy, the one who is a sabīva,

original: slob dpon gnong can 'gram dang ni //
analyzed: slob dpon gnong can 'gram dang ni //
translated: the one who is a teacher, the one who is a sinner, the one who is a bank,

original: grol ba'i las dang gros byed pa //
analyzed: grol ba'i las dang gros byed pa //
translated: the one who is a liberated worker, the one who is a counselor,

original: dung gi spyan pa dung pa dang // spyan pa dang por byed pa mtshungs //
analyzed: dung gi spyan pa dung pa dang // spyan pa dang por byed pa mtshungs //
translated: The one with eyes like a conch, the one with eyes like a conch shell, and the one with eyes like a lotus.

original: dar gu li ka so rtsi byin //
analyzed: dar gu li ka so rtsi byin //
translated: The one who gives tooth powder, the one who gives tooth powder.

original: rab 'jug byed dang 'jug pa po //
analyzed: rab 'jug byed dang 'jug pa po //
translated: The one who enters, the one who makes enter,

original: 'jug byed bu dang rgyug byed pa //
analyzed: 'jug byed bu dang rgyug byed pa //
translated: the one who makes enter, the one who runs.

original: dzam gh'a ka ri dzam bhi ka / btsun mo'i sku srung kanytsa ki / gnas byed dang ni nyug rum pa //
analyzed: dzam gh'a ka ri dzam bhi ka / btsun mo'i sku srung kanytsa ki / gnas byed dang ni nyug rum pa //
translated: The one who paralyzes, the one who paralyzes, the one who protects the queen, the one who protects the queen, the one who stays in place, the one who stays in place,

original: ma ning nyams pa za ma mtshungs //
analyzed: ma ning nyams pa za ma mtshungs //
translated: the one who is neuter, the one who is degenerate, the one who is neuter, the one who is degenerate.

original: yang dag thob byed lus nyad ba //
analyzed: yang dag thob byed lus nyad ba //
translated: The one who attains correctly, the one who is bent over.

original: zhabs thog pa dang 'tsho ba pa //
analyzed: zhabs thog pa dang 'tsho ba pa //
translated: The one who is on foot, the one who lives.

original: grogs byed la dang spyid byed pa //
analyzed: grogs byed la dang spyid byed pa //
translated: The one who helps, the one who is a friend,

original: yul mthar gnas pa'i rgyal po dgra //
analyzed: yul mthar gnas pa'i rgyal po dgra //
translated: the king who lives at the end of the country, the enemy.

original: de yi pha rol bshes yin no //
analyzed: de yi pha rol bshes yin no //
translated: The one who is on the other side is a friend.

original: au p'a shin bar gnas yul //
analyzed: au p'a shin bar gnas yul //
translated: The one who lives in Upaśin,

original: rtsa 'dzin dang ni rgyal gnas so //
analyzed: rtsa 'dzin dang ni rgyal gnas so //
translated: the one who holds the veins, the one who lives in the kingdom.

original: dgra bo mi dga' yongs bgrod dang // dgrar 'dzin ba dang bshes mi byed //
analyzed: dgra bo mi dga' yongs bgrod dang // dgrar 'dzin ba dang bshes mi byed //
translated: The one who is disliked by enemies, the one who travels everywhere, the one who holds enemies, the one who does not make friends.

original: sdang byed / zhe 'gras /
analyzed: sdang byed / zhe 'gras /
translated: The one who hates, the one who is angry,

original: 'khon byed dang // mi mdza' ba dang pha rol rgol //
analyzed: 'khon byed dang // mi mdza' ba dang pha rol rgol //
translated: the one who holds grudges, the one who is not friendly, the one who opposes from the other side.

original: mngon bgrod dgra byed rnam sdang dang // mi phan byed dang phyir rgol dang // yongs gnas 'gran zla mngon gzhom bya //
analyzed: mngon bgrod dgra byed rnam sdang dang // mi phan byed dang phyir rgol dang // yongs gnas 'gran zla mngon gzhom bya //
translated: unhelpful, adversarial, and who live in the vicinity, and those who are rivals.

original: dzi gha kun tu 'gran sdang byed //
analyzed: dzi gha kun tu 'gran sdang byed //
translated: Jiha is used for those who are hostile and competitive.

original: rnam sdang bzod byed mi dga' byed //
analyzed: rnam sdang bzod byed mi dga' byed //
translated: “Hostile” is used for those who are intolerant and disagreeable.🔽“Rival” is used for those who are equal in status,

original: bzhin mnyam mtshungs pa 'gran zla dang // grogs dang gros gnyen /
analyzed: bzhin mnyam mtshungs pa 'gran zla dang // grogs dang gros gnyen /
translated: “Friend” and “ally” are used for those who are close.🔽“Relative” is used for those who are related by blood.🔽“Companion” is used for those who are intimate.

original: snag gnyen dang // sdug dang / rtsed rol /
analyzed: snag gnyen dang // sdug dang / rtsed rol /
translated: “Playmate” is used for those who are close friends.

original: lhan cig spyod //🔽s'i sh'urtha n'i zhes pa yang //
analyzed: lhan cig spyod // s'i sh'urtha n'i zhes pa yang //
translated: “Associate” is used for those who are in the same social circle.

original: dbang bcas legs spyong /
analyzed: dbang bcas legs spyong /
translated: “Servant” is used for those who are under one’s control.🔽“Good person” is used for those who are virtuous.🔽“Gatherer” is used for those who bring things together.🔽“Companion” is used for those who are in the same social circle.

original: legs sdud dang // 'grogs dang 'dun pa'i skye bo dang // bdun brgyud gnyen dang mdza' grogs bshes //
analyzed: legs sdud dang // 'grogs dang 'dun pa'i skye bo dang // bdun brgyud gnyen dang mdza' grogs bshes //
translated: “Relative” is used for those who are related by blood.🔽“Friend” is used for those who are close friends.🔽“Neighbor” is used for those who live nearby.🔽“Green” is used for those who are young.

original: ljang gu'i mtshon 'dar brjod pa dang // skad cig tsam gyis mtshon gyur pa //
analyzed: ljang gu'i mtshon 'dar brjod pa dang // skad cig tsam gyis mtshon gyur pa //
translated: “Weapon” is used for those who are armed.🔽“Blue” is used for those who are stable.🔽“Joy” is used for those who are happy.🔽“Abandon” is used for those who are to be rejected.🔽“Play” is used for those who are playful.🔽“Sky” is used for those who are in the sky.

original: sngon po'i chos bzhin brtan pa dang // dga' dang dor byas rjes su 'jug / mkha' la rtsen dang rol rtsed dang // der ni nye bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: sngon po'i chos bzhin brtan pa dang // dga' dang dor byas rjes su 'jug / mkha' la rtsen dang rol rtsed dang // der ni nye bar gyur pa'o //
translated: “Sport” is used for those who are engaged in play.

original: lta nyul dang ni rtog mi pa //
analyzed: lta nyul dang ni rtog mi pa //
translated: The spy, the investigator,

original: rtog dpyod @137b byed dang nyul mi dang // ldum bu pa dang so rtog mi //
analyzed: rtog dpyod @137b byed dang nyul mi dang // ldum bu pa dang so rtog mi //
translated: The one who examines, the one who searches, the one who looks, the one who observes,

original: bya gtong dang ni nang yan no //
analyzed: bya gtong dang ni nang yan no //
translated: The one who lets go of the bird, the one who is inside.🔽The one who knows the year, the astrologer, the one called god,

original: lo shes rtsis mkhan lha zhes dang // lha yig pa dang shes ldan dang // dus shes yung tsam thang cig shes //
analyzed: lo shes rtsis mkhan lha zhes dang // lha yig pa dang shes ldan dang // dus shes yung tsam thang cig shes //
translated: The one who writes about the gods, the wise one, the one who knows time, the one who knows a yūka, the one who knows a kṣaṇa,

original: gnas shes 'grangs byed lha 'dri ba //
analyzed: gnas shes 'grangs byed lha 'dri ba //
translated: The one who knows the place, the one who fills, the one who asks about the gods,

original: gus par 'dri dang sems brjod 'gyur //
analyzed: gus par 'dri dang sems brjod 'gyur //
translated: The one who asks respectfully, the one who expresses the mind,

original: pra sya sha ka ti zhes pa'o //
analyzed: pra sya sha ka ti zhes pa'o //
translated: The one called prasyakaṭika.

original: der ni nges 'gro sbyin pa dang // lha la 'dri dang nye bar thos //
analyzed: der ni nges 'gro sbyin pa dang // lha la 'dri dang nye bar thos //
translated: There, the one who definitely goes, the one who gives, the one who asks the gods, the one who hears nearby,

original: rgyud dang grub mtha' shes pa dang // sbyin bdag khyim bdag mtshungs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyud dang grub mtha' shes pa dang // sbyin bdag khyim bdag mtshungs pa'o //
translated: The one who knows the tantras and tenets, the one who is equal to the patron and householder.

original: bris mkhan dang ni yig mkhan dang // yi ge pa dang 'dri byed pa //
analyzed: bris mkhan dang ni yig mkhan dang // yi ge pa dang 'dri byed pa //
translated: The one who writes, the one who writes letters, the one who writes letters, the one who asks,

original: kir ka dang sh'anti ka //
analyzed: kir ka dang sh'anti ka //
translated: The one called kirka, the one called śāntika,

original: yi ge can dang snag tsha'i zong //
analyzed: yi ge can dang snag tsha'i zong //
translated: The one with letters, the one with ink,

original: k'a kshi ka dang po li ka / de nas me l'a bu rma l'a //
analyzed: k'a kshi ka dang po li ka / de nas me l'a bu rma l'a //
translated: The one called kākṣika, the one called poṭika, then the one called melāva, the one called malāva,

original: dga' byed dang ni yi ge 'chags //
analyzed: dga' byed dang ni yi ge 'chags //
translated: The one who delights, the one who arranges the letters.

original: snag tsha'i nor bu snag tsha'i nor //
analyzed: snag tsha'i nor bu snag tsha'i nor //
translated: The ink gem is the ink treasure.

original: yi ge khron can b'a rta la //
analyzed: yi ge khron can b'a rta la //
translated: The letter carrier is the messenger.

original: snag tsha chu ngang ma l'a dang // mda' la mig sman snag tsha'o //
analyzed: snag tsha chu ngang ma l'a dang // mda' la mig sman snag tsha'o //
translated: The ink is the water of the female duck. The eye ointment is the ink.

original: myu gu yi ge'i 'dab can dang // k'a tsa na dang yi ge 'ching //
analyzed: myu gu yi ge'i 'dab can dang // k'a tsa na dang yi ge 'ching //
translated: The sprout is the leaf of the letter. The kācana is the binding of the letter.

original: yi ge'i pho nya khu tshur byed //
analyzed: yi ge'i pho nya khu tshur byed //
translated: The letter messenger is the fist.

original: phrin yig brjod dang rjod byed pa //
analyzed: phrin yig brjod dang rjod byed pa //
translated: The letter is the expression and the expressed.

original: yi ge'i gnas dang dri gtsang khang //
analyzed: yi ge'i gnas dang dri gtsang khang //
translated: The place of the letter is the pure smell house.

original: rgyas 'debs rkyen byed 'dri byed dang // byi bya /
analyzed: rgyas 'debs rkyen byed 'dri byed dang // byi bya /
translated: The seal is the condition, the smell is the smearing, and the bee is the smearing.

original: kun tu bri bya dang // yi ge'i rim pa rim pa gnyis rnams so //
analyzed: kun tu bri bya dang // yi ge'i rim pa rim pa gnyis rnams so //
translated: The letter is the all-around smearing, and the letter stage is the two stages.

original: la kh'i la ka 'phrin yig khyer //
analyzed: la kh'i la ka 'phrin yig khyer //
translated: The pass is the pass, the letter is the letter carrier.

original: lhag par 'phrin yig spyod byed 'dod //
analyzed: lhag par 'phrin yig spyod byed 'dod //
translated: The special letter is the letter conduct.

original: yig mkhan las byed rkyen bcug pa'o //
analyzed: yig mkhan las byed rkyen bcug pa'o //
translated: The scribe is the worker, the condition is the insertion.

original: skyes kha dang ni pho nya ba //
analyzed: skyes kha dang ni pho nya ba //
translated: The birth mouth is the messenger.

original: du tyi de dngos las yin no //🔽lam la tshong pa 'gron po dang // lam 'grul 'gron lam gnas spos pa //
analyzed: du tyi de dngos las yin no // lam la tshong pa 'gron po dang // lam 'grul 'gron lam gnas spos pa //
translated: The duti is the actual thing.🔽On the path, the merchant is the traveler, the path traveler is the guest on the path.

original: 'gro byed lam po de nas ni //
analyzed: 'gro byed lam po de nas ni //
translated: The goer is the path.

original: sdud byed lam pa dang ni rgyud //
analyzed: sdud byed lam pa dang ni rgyud //
translated: The path is the collector and the continuum.

original: mnyam pa sa mu na s'a tha //
analyzed: mnyam pa sa mu na s'a tha //
translated: The equal one is the saṃsāra.

original: dzangka 'dug gnas 'di dag mtshungs //
analyzed: dzangka 'dug gnas 'di dag mtshungs //
translated: The abode is the same as the dwelling.

original: dz'a ga ma la sogs pa'i rab tu byed pa'o //
analyzed: dz'a ga ma la sogs pa'i rab tu byed pa'o //
translated: This is the chapter on jāgama and so on.

original: bdag po blon po thugs ches dang // mdzod dang yul 'khor rdzong dang dpung //
analyzed: bdag po blon po thugs ches dang // mdzod dang yul 'khor rdzong dang dpung //
translated: The minister, the trusted one, the treasury, the country, the fort, and the army

original: rgyal po'i yan lag gnyis yin no //
analyzed: rgyal po'i yan lag gnyis yin no //
translated: are the two branches of the king.

original: khab dang pho brang zhes pa dang // dums dang 'thab dang chas pa dang // gnas dang nor gtong gzhan brten rnams //
analyzed: khab dang pho brang zhes pa dang // dums dang 'thab dang chas pa dang // gnas dang nor gtong gzhan brten rnams //
translated: The palace, the royal residence, the assembly, the battle, the preparation, the abode, the giving of wealth, and the reliance on others

original: drug rnams yon tan zhes bya'o //
analyzed: drug rnams yon tan zhes bya'o //
translated: are the six called the qualities.

original: nus pa dang ni mthu stobs dang // dga' bar byas dang sngags bzlas dang // zad dang @138a * //
analyzed: nus pa dang ni mthu stobs dang // dga' bar byas dang sngags bzlas dang // zad dang @138a * //
translated: The ability, the power, the strength, the delight, the recitation of the mantra, the exhaustion,🔽the abiding, and the increase

original: gnas dang 'phel ba dang // sde tshan gsum po rig pa'o //
analyzed: gnas dang 'phel ba dang // sde tshan gsum po rig pa'o //
translated: are the three groups that are knowledge.

original: rnam par gnon dang skyes bu'i mthu //🔽gzi brjid dang ni mdangs dang stobs //
analyzed: rnam par gnon dang skyes bu'i mthu // gzi brjid dang ni mdangs dang stobs //
translated: The subjugation, the power of the person,🔽the splendor, the luster, and the strength,

original: dpung dang mthu brjid can dang ni //
analyzed: dpung dang mthu brjid can dang ni //
translated: the army, the powerful one, the glorious one,🔽and the one with the power of the army🔽are the five called the power.

original: bang mdzod nor gyis gang ba dang // dbye dang sdud dang dums dang ni //
analyzed: bang mdzod nor gyis gang ba dang // dbye dang sdud dang dums dang ni //
translated: The treasury is filled with wealth,

original: dpya 'tshal thabs ni rnam pa bzhi //
analyzed: dpya 'tshal thabs ni rnam pa bzhi //
translated: and with the four methods of division, gathering, increase, and🔽taxation.🔽Taxation, gathering, and increase,

original: khral dang sdud dang dpyad dang ni //
analyzed: khral dang sdud dang dpyad dang ni //
translated: and

original: phra ma dang ni skyom mtshungs //
analyzed: phra ma dang ni skyom mtshungs //
translated: slander and drinking.

original: de nas dbye dang nye bar 'gyed //
analyzed: de nas dbye dang nye bar 'gyed //
translated: Then, division and distribution,

original: au pa dha ni chos sogs kyi //
analyzed: au pa dha ni chos sogs kyi //
translated: and the upadhana, etc.

original: gang zhig nye bar blta ba'o //
analyzed: gang zhig nye bar blta ba'o //
translated: are what is to be seen.

original: drug ni lta bar byed pa ste //
analyzed: drug ni lta bar byed pa ste //
translated: The six are the ones who see,

original: gang zhig gsum sogs spyod yul lo //
analyzed: gang zhig gsum sogs spyod yul lo //
translated: and the three, etc., are the objects of experience.

original: mtshungs pa blo thub yid ches so //
analyzed: mtshungs pa blo thub yid ches so //
translated: Equality, confidence, and trust.

original: nyams na dman pa ji ltar 'grims //
analyzed: nyams na dman pa ji ltar 'grims //
translated: If violated, how does one proceed with the inferior?🔽If not violated, the principle is to contemplate,

original: ma nyams rigs pa rtog pa dang // gzugs ston pa dang mtshungs par gnas //
analyzed: ma nyams rigs pa rtog pa dang // gzugs ston pa dang mtshungs par gnas //
translated: and to abide in equality with the display of form.🔽Principle, method, attainment,🔽appropriateness, logic, and according with the system,

original: rigs pa thabs dang thob pa dang // 'os pa 'thad pa lugs bzhin dang // rigs pas thob dang gnas su brjod //
analyzed: rigs pa thabs dang thob pa dang // 'os pa 'thad pa lugs bzhin dang // rigs pas thob dang gnas su brjod //

original: mngags pa gang zhig la ma btsas pa //
analyzed: mngags pa gang zhig la ma btsas pa //
translated: What is sent is not born.

original: gang de so sor bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gang de so sor bstan pa'o //

analyzed: des bstan kun tu bstan pa dang // mngags bstan gdams pa bstan pa dang // bstan pa dka' dang rjes su gnang //

analyzed: khrims lugs dang ni 'dzin pa'o // kun tu gnas dang yul chos dang // yang dag rab 'dzin kun tu 'ching //

analyzed: nges gzung / sdoms dang / 'ching ba mtshungs //

original: nyes pa / nongs pa /
analyzed: nyes pa / nongs pa /

analyzed: skyon can dang // tundi k'a dang rigs bab 'gro //

analyzed: bur shing rtse //

analyzed: zab mo'i rigs dang glang po bcas // gang 'gyur lcags kyus gdul dka' ba //

analyzed: g-yo ba can dang bya la ka / shin tu gdug dang ma tam skyes //

analyzed: gcer bu rab bye mirbhinna //

analyzed: mchog tu rnam par rgyal byed pa //

original: gang 'gyur phal chen myos ral can //
analyzed: gang 'gyur phal chen myos ral can //

analyzed: p'u ri sh'a sogs nges par dregs //

analyzed: glang mo spos kyi glang mo de //

analyzed: gang zhig khro byed khros pa'o //

original: skad cig gis ni dbang du 'gyur //
analyzed: skad cig gis ni dbang du 'gyur //

original: gal te mtshon pas bh'a sto//
analyzed: gal te mtshon pas bh'a sto//

analyzed: 'od zer can dang mchod sbyin gyi //

analyzed: glang po mchog rgyal rtags pa mtshungs //

original: bi tam glang po phal pa'o //
analyzed: bi tam glang po phal pa'o //

original: glang tshogs glang po 'dus pa'o //
analyzed: glang tshogs glang po 'dus pa'o //

original: dud 'gro byin dang gdab pa dang // glang po'i yongs 'dren bi dha'o //
analyzed: dud 'gro byin dang gdab pa dang // glang po'i yongs 'dren bi dha'o //

original: bum pa'i 'og ni b'a ha nyam //
analyzed: bum pa'i 'og ni b'a ha nyam //

analyzed: pra ti ma ni de yi 'og / bum pa can dang glang 'bur gnyis //

analyzed: de yi bar ni bidha'o // a'a rakta ni bum pa'i mtshams //

analyzed: ganda sham kha 'gram pa'i mtshams //

original: mche ba'i sha ni pra beshta //
analyzed: mche ba'i sha ni pra beshta //

original: ka ri' ra ka so'i rtsa ba //
analyzed: ka ri' ra ka so'i rtsa ba //

original: sna yi gong ni stu la'o //
analyzed: sna yi gong ni stu la'o //

original: lag sor lag pa'i ze 'brul //
analyzed: lag sor lag pa'i ze 'brul //

original: dpral ba aa ba gr'a ha'o //
analyzed: dpral ba aa ba gr'a ha'o //

original: rgyab kyi sha ni ta lya l'a ma //
analyzed: rgyab kyi sha ni ta lya l'a ma //

original: phrag pa'i phyogs ni a'a pa ni //
analyzed: phrag pa'i phyogs ni a'a pa ni //

original: a'i kishi k'a ni mig 'bras so //🔽mig gi zur phyogs nir++y'a nam //
analyzed: a'i kishi k'a ni mig 'bras so // mig gi zur phyogs nir++y'a nam //
translated: Ākiṣikā is the eyeball.🔽The corner of the eye is Niryaṇa.🔽Sandhana is below the eye socket.

analyzed: sanda na ni mig rus 'og / a'a ya sk'a ra byin pa'i rtsa //

original: pro ha rkang pa'i tshigs la'o //
analyzed: pro ha rkang pa'i tshigs la'o //

original: paksha bh'a ga rtsi ba ma'i cha //🔽danta bh'a ga mche ba'i rtse //
analyzed: paksha bh'a ga rtsi ba ma'i cha // danta bh'a ga mche ba'i rtse //
translated: Pakṣabhāga is the part of the armpit.🔽Dantabhāga is the tip of the tusk.

original: rje ngar phyi dang rtse mo'i ni //
analyzed: rje ngar phyi dang rtse mo'i ni //
translated: The outer calf and the tip are

original: aa pa ram dang yo gi ta //🔽rje ngar bdun dang rtse mo'i cha //
analyzed: aa pa ram dang yo gi ta //🔽rje ngar bdun dang rtse mo'i cha //
translated: Aparama and Yogita.🔽The calf and the tip are

analyzed: g'a trar 'gyur ro so rtsa ka / mjug ma'i rtsa ba dang ni mtha'o //

original: gang po'i kha cha padma'i kam / rna ba'i rtsa ba ts'u li k'a //
analyzed: gang po'i kha cha padma'i kam / rna ba'i rtsa ba ts'u li k'a //

original: ru ladzdzhe l'a rna ba'i nag / myos pa'i sbyor ba bya st'a ra //
analyzed: ru ladzdzhe l'a rna ba'i nag / myos pa'i sbyor ba bya st'a ra //

analyzed: de nas sbyin pa myos @139b pa'o ; / glang po'i rgyan la /

original: shi ma g'at //🔽glang po'i mgo dang lag ldan mgo / hakko gardzdza 'bod pa'o //
analyzed: shi ma g'at // glang po'i mgo dang lag ldan mgo / hakko gardzdza 'bod pa'o //

original: lcags kyu la ni shri ni 'o //
analyzed: lcags kyu la ni shri ni 'o //

original: rna ba 'bigs pa karna r'a //
analyzed: rna ba 'bigs pa karna r'a //

original: 'ching ma sa thag /
analyzed: 'ching ma sa thag /

analyzed: la l'i'o // 'dogs pa'i ka ba aa la nam // sham gar kosha da zhes pa'ang //

analyzed: lcags sgrog b'a tsi hinyidza ra //

original: lcags thag aantu ka zhes pa'o //
analyzed: lcags thag aantu ka zhes pa'o //

original: de nas prish'a ka ksh'a dang // ba ra tra ni glang po'i thag / pr'a ga bvi ni glang bo'i chings //
analyzed: de nas prish'a ka ksh'a dang // ba ra tra ni glang po'i thag / pr'a ga bvi ni glang bo'i chings //

original: n'a r'i glang po'i chings so //
analyzed: n'a r'i glang po'i chings so //
translated: The elephant's fetter is nāri.

original: aa pa ba ta 'ching bas 'dzin //
analyzed: aa pa ba ta 'ching bas 'dzin //

original: glang po mchog ni gu ta nam //
analyzed: glang po mchog ni gu ta nam //

original: rtogs ldan skye bo dam pa dang // dze ga ninda dza ga rdza ni //
analyzed: rtogs ldan skye bo dam pa dang // dze ga ninda dza ga rdza ni //

original: mkhris pa'i rims dang b'a ka la //
analyzed: mkhris pa'i rims dang b'a ka la //
translated: The fever of bile, and Bāka,

original: skyon bral brtsegs pa b'a ka la //
analyzed: skyon bral brtsegs pa b'a ka la //

original: la ba khra'o //
analyzed: la ba khra'o //

original: glang po'i g-yog / kha dog stan dang / ku tha'o //
analyzed: glang po'i g-yog / kha dog stan dang / ku tha'o //

original: rta dang chu 'thung myur 'gro dang // 'gro mgyogs /
analyzed: rta dang chu 'thung myur 'gro dang // 'gro mgyogs /
translated: The horse, the water-drinker, the swift one, and the fast-goer,🔽The seventh fast-goer, and the one born from a lotus, and the one who goes,

analyzed: mgyogs 'gro bdun pa dang // sinku skyes dang 'gro byed dang // sgrub byed gshog ldan ha ya dang // 'phrog byed dpal gyi bu dang ni //

original: si nam rnam gdon rlung las skyes //
analyzed: si nam rnam gdon rlung las skyes //
translated: And the one born from the wind, the Sīna.

original: rlung gi shing rta yang yang za //
analyzed: rlung gi shing rta yang yang za //

original: rnga yab can dang hi sh'i dang // p'i ti de ka sha ka dang // 'gro byed phung po rmig pa can //
analyzed: rnga yab can dang hi sh'i dang // p'i ti de ka sha ka dang // 'gro byed phung po rmig pa can //

analyzed: ki mb'i s'a li ho dra dang // ral can tshangs pa rang skyes dang // mchod sbyin phyugs dang ku d'u ra //

original: rgyal 'dzin ri dags ral pa dang // dz'a nu ba dhu rtsa gdong dang // rnga yab mjug ma can rnams so /
analyzed: rgyal 'dzin ri dags ral pa dang // dz'a nu ba dhu rtsa gdong dang // rnga yab mjug ma can rnams so /

original: 25 / cang shes dang ni rigs ldan dang // rlung dang kun shes zhes kyang ngo //
analyzed: 25 / cang shes dang ni rigs ldan dang // rlung dang kun shes zhes kyang ngo //

original: rta mchog sindu b'a ra dang // rang rigs dang ni legs brtson ldan //
analyzed: rta mchog sindu b'a ra dang // rang rigs dang ni legs brtson ldan //
translated: Sindhu-vāra, and Su-varṇa.🔽Ugra-vega, and Javana,🔽Śānti, Su-gata, and Viśākha,🔽Aśva, Aśvatara, and Kara,

original: lhag par rgyugs dang bang ldan dang // nam par dul dang legs 'gro dang // bri sh'a na la shugs 'gro dang // lhag spyod aa shva ta ra dang // kha ra dang ni skyob byed pa //
analyzed: lhag par rgyugs dang bang ldan dang // nam par dul dang legs 'gro dang // bri sh'a na la shugs 'gro dang // lhag spyod aa shva ta ra dang // kha ra dang ni skyob byed pa //

analyzed: turmim / sa mva // rta dkar dang // dpal gyi shing can gang gi ming //
translated: Turmiṃ, Saṃvara,🔽Śveta, and Śrī-druma,

analyzed: shing gi rjes su mtshon byed pa //
translated: whose names are indicated by the word “tree.”

original: rta ni bzang po lnga re rnams //
analyzed: rta ni bzang po lnga re rnams //
translated: Each of these five good horses

original: yan lag lnga rnams legs par rgyas //
analyzed: yan lag lnga rnams legs par rgyas //
translated: has five limbs well developed.

original: ma lli k'a mig dkar min rnams //
analyzed: ma lli k'a mig dkar min rnams //

original: nag dang dbang po'i gzhu lta bu //
analyzed: nag dang dbang po'i gzhu lta bu //

original: gshog ldan rta gtsang mchod sbyin la //
analyzed: gshog ldan rta gtsang mchod sbyin la //

original: gang zhig mchod sbyin thob pa'i @140a * //
analyzed: gang zhig mchod sbyin thob pa'i @140a * //

original: mchog rlung gi rta dang sa yi phyogs //
analyzed: mchog rlung gi rta dang sa yi phyogs //

original: rlung tshogs / 'phrog byed /🔽too ra bee //
analyzed: rlung tshogs / 'phrog byed / too ra bee //
translated: The wind-collection, the thief,

original: mdung can dang ni rnam par dul //
analyzed: mdung can dang ni rnam par dul //
translated: the one with a spear, and the one who is disciplined,🔽the one who is divided, the one who trembles, the one born on an island,

original: dbye ba 'dar byed gling skyes dang // mi ldan yul du skyes pa dang // b'a n'a yu skyes /
analyzed: dbye ba 'dar byed gling skyes dang // mi ldan yul du skyes pa dang // b'a n'a yu skyes /

original: p'a ta sig skyes //🔽b'a ta zhes pha rol la pa //
analyzed: p'a ta sig skyes // b'a ta zhes pha rol la pa //

original: rgyab ldan dang ni gnas pa'o //
analyzed: rgyab ldan dang ni gnas pa'o //
translated: the one who is behind, and the one who abides.

original: shing rta 'dren byed ra tha sye //
analyzed: shing rta 'dren byed ra tha sye //
translated: The one who draws the chariot is Rathasya.

original: bde bar byed dang bde bar spyod //
analyzed: bde bar byed dang bde bar spyod //
translated: The one who makes happy and the one who practices happily,

original: rte'u dang ni thu ru nyid //
analyzed: rte'u dang ni thu ru nyid //

original: mo rta rgod ma b'a m'i dang // aa shv'a /
analyzed: mo rta rgod ma b'a m'i dang // aa shv'a /

original: ha y'i / rab skyed ma /🔽6 / rta yi khyu dang rta yi tshogs //
analyzed: ha y'i / rab skyed ma / 6 / rta yi khyu dang rta yi tshogs //
translated: the one who is born from a mare,🔽the herd of horses, the group of horses,

original: rgod ma'i khyu dang rgod ma'i tshogs //
analyzed: rgod ma'i khyu dang rgod ma'i tshogs //
translated: the herd of mares, the group of mares,

original: dpal gyi shing can snying gar 'khyil //
analyzed: dpal gyi shing can snying gar 'khyil //
translated: the one with the tree of glory, the one who curls in the heart,

original: mdzes byed mgrin par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: mdzes byed mgrin par gnas pa'o //
translated: the one who beautifies, the one who abides in the throat,

original: ze rngog ru gnas gang 'khyil ba //
analyzed: ze rngog ru gnas gang 'khyil ba //
translated: the one who curls in the place of the testicles,

original: de ni lha yi nor bur brjod //
analyzed: de ni lha yi nor bur brjod //
translated: that is called the divine jewel.

original: kathyan rta yi sked pa'o //
analyzed: kathyan rta yi sked pa'o //

analyzed: he sh'a h'e sh'a de yi skad // 'tsher 'gro // phyogs bzhir 'gro ba dang // yongs skor mchod 'gro ring du 'gro //

original: lnga po 'di rnams rta yi 'gros //
analyzed: lnga po 'di rnams rta yi 'gros //

original: rta yi gdong dang mtshul pa'o //
analyzed: rta yi gdong dang mtshul pa'o //
translated: The horse’s face and neck.🔽The mane and the crest.

original: dze t'a rgyal can rgyal bar byed //
analyzed: dze t'a rgyal can rgyal bar byed //

original: dpa' bo rab stobs rnam gnon can //
analyzed: dpa' bo rab stobs rnam gnon can //

original: dpa' spyod / shor ba ;

analyzed: ral gri dang ni dkyil 'khor can //

analyzed: rtse mo can dang @142b kri b'a na //

analyzed: mtshon cha'i gzhi dang 'dzin byed 'dzin //

analyzed: pags ldan drang po'i ral gri dang // ka t'i ta la /

analyzed: aarga nam // 'khor lo'i cha can g-yul du 'dzin //

original: se ru ral gri'i yu ba ste //
analyzed: se ru ral gri'i yu ba ste //

original: de yi 'ching thag mo kha la //
analyzed: de yi 'ching thag mo kha la //

original: pr'a ty'a k'a ra /
analyzed: pr'a ty'a k'a ra /

original: ka la ha //
analyzed: ka la ha //

analyzed: si dha na ka ral gri'i shubs //

original: tho ba 'joms byed gha na'o //
analyzed: tho ba 'joms byed gha na'o //

original: dbyug pa lcags bcings pa ri gha //
analyzed: dbyug pa lcags bcings pa ri gha //

original: skyed gri ka ra b'a li'o //
analyzed: skyed gri ka ra b'a li'o //

original: bhindi b'a la mda' thung mtshungs //
analyzed: bhindi b'a la mda' thung mtshungs //

analyzed: dgra sta sta ri gcod byed dang // sta mo zhes pa'o dgra sta'i 'og / gcod byed /

original: gzod dang gri gri gug / chu gri gri thung tstshu ri k'a / mdzod kyi ral gri ra la gri'i bu //
analyzed: gzod dang gri gri gug / chu gri gri thung tstshu ri k'a / mdzod kyi ral gri ra la gri'i bu //

analyzed: mda' bo che ni to ma ra // mdung dang mtshon ring thag mdung dang // ka r'a ba dang sha la rnams //

analyzed: mdung thung dang ni k'a shr'i mtshungs // 'phang mdung / sor mdung /

analyzed: bir shang ga / mdung dang mtshams can zhes pa'o //
translated: [The weapon] called bīraka is a spear.🔽[The weapon] called śakti is a lance.

original: rtse gsum pa dang mtshams gsum pa //
analyzed: rtse gsum pa dang mtshams gsum pa //

original: phur bu / brtan pa /
analyzed: phur bu / brtan pa /

analyzed: sham ku dang // zhi ba me tog cha rnams mtshungs //

analyzed: sna mdor ko ta ya zhes so //

analyzed: zur dang mtshon cha rnam pa bzhi // lag grol 'khrul 'khor grol ba dang // mukt'a /

analyzed: grol ba chu gri la sogs pa // mukt'a mukta gsal shing sogs //

original: 'khrul 'khor grol ba mda' la sogs //
analyzed: 'khrul 'khor grol ba mda' la sogs //

original: mda' skyong mda' ni ring ba la //
analyzed: mda' skyong mda' ni ring ba la //

original: phyi rol nges dang batti sham //
analyzed: phyi rol nges dang batti sham //

original: dbyug pa / gsal shing be con dang // 'khor lo la sogs mtshon rigs dang // mda' dang mtshon cha goms pa ni //
analyzed: dbyug pa / gsal shing be con dang // 'khor lo la sogs mtshon rigs dang // mda' dang mtshon cha goms pa ni //
translated: the arrow, and the weapon are

original: au b'a pa ni khu ra l'i //
analyzed: au b'a pa ni khu ra l'i //
translated: the upavāsa of the khura.

original: rgyal pos dmag la mnga' gsol byed //
analyzed: rgyal pos dmag la mnga' gsol byed //

original: dgra la dpung ni sngon 'gro dang // gang zhig dmag 'gro de dbang bskur //
analyzed: dgra la dpung ni sngon 'gro dang // gang zhig dmag 'gro de dbang bskur //

analyzed: phyir rgol byed dang phyir sngon 'gro //

analyzed: 'thab skyod shin tu 'gog pa'o // kun @143a * //

analyzed: 'jug dang de ru gnas pa dang // yul lta pra ti ra thar 'dod //

analyzed: brkyang ba dang ni ru brkyang dang // pha rol dmag nang 'jug pa'i don // bee t'a li k'a go phyed pa //

analyzed: bde ba sgrub par byed pa'o //

translated: destroying, definitely removing, harming,

original: de bskyed ces pa rnams su 'gyur /
analyzed: de bskyed ces pa rnams su 'gyur /
translated: The five are: “to generate,” “to be generated,” “to be generated by that,” “to generate that,” and “to generate.”🔽The five are: “to sleep,” “to be asleep,” “to be asleep by that,” “to sleep that,” and “to sleep.”

original: 47 / gnyid log mtshan mos da pa shi / sa dang me dang chu dag go / mnyam pa dang ni 'bras bu bcas //🔽lnga pa nyid du dus kyi chos //
analyzed: 47 / gnyid log mtshan mos da pa shi / sa dang me dang chu dag go / mnyam pa dang ni 'bras bu bcas // lnga pa nyid du dus kyi chos //
translated: The five are: “to be extinguished,” “to be extinguished by that,” “to be extinguished by that,” “to extinguish that,” and “to extinguish.”🔽The five are: “to be destroyed,” “to be destroyed by that,” “to be destroyed by that,” “to destroy that,” and “to destroy.”

original: lta ba'i mtha' dang 'jig pa dang // shin tu 'gro dang nges par thim //
analyzed: lta ba'i mtha' dang 'jig pa dang // shin tu 'gro dang nges par thim //
translated: The five are: “to go,” “to go by that,” “to go by that,” “to go that,” and “to go.”🔽The five are: “to be absorbed,” “to be absorbed by that,” “to be absorbed by that,” “to absorb that,” and “to absorb.”

original: ring du / chas dang / kun tu gnas //🔽lnga nyid mtha' dang zhig pa dang // 'chi dang / shi dang / nub pa dang // nges par lhung dang sa thob pa'o /🔽17 / ro dang / rab thob lnga pa nyid //
analyzed: ring du / chas dang / kun tu gnas // lnga nyid mtha' dang zhig pa dang // 'chi dang / shi dang / nub pa dang // nges par lhung dang sa thob pa'o / 17 / ro dang / rab thob lnga pa nyid //
translated: The five are: “to be far,” “to be far by that,” “to be far by that,” “to be far from that,” and “to be far.”🔽The five are: “to be an end,” “to be an end by that,” “to be an end by that,” “to end that,” and “to end.”🔽The five are: “to be a corpse,” “to be a corpse by that,” “to be a corpse by that,” “to be a corpse of that,” and “to be a corpse.”

original: tshe 'das nyer thob rab tu bkod //🔽gzhan song / rab thim /🔽kun tu gnas //
analyzed: tshe 'das nyer thob rab tu bkod // gzhan song / rab thim / kun tu gnas //
translated: The five are: “to be a corpse,” “to be a corpse by that,” “to be a corpse by that,” “to be a corpse of that,” and “to be a corpse.”

original: rab sod dang ni gzhan du song //🔽bcu pa zhes pa rnams su 'gyur /🔽11 / ro dang / phung po /🔽gnas son dang // ro sha /🔽sa 'phel / gnas skabs lnga /
analyzed: rab sod dang ni gzhan du song // bcu pa zhes pa rnams su 'gyur / 11 / ro dang / phung po / gnas son dang // ro sha / sa 'phel / gnas skabs lnga /
translated: The five are: “to be a corpse,” “to be a corpse by that,” “to be a corpse by that,” “to be a corpse of that,” and “to be a corpse.”

original: 6 / mthar 'gyur dang ni /🔽b'a ru tha //
analyzed: 6 / mthar 'gyur dang ni /🔽b'a ru tha //
translated: The five are: “to be a corpse,” “to be a corpse by that,” “to be a corpse by that,” “to be a corpse of that,” and “to be a corpse.”

original: ro khri can dang / b'a ti dang // ro yi shing rta shing gi gyad /🔽6 / ka bandha dang / byed ldan ni //🔽mgo bo dang bral khog pa'o //
analyzed: ro khri can dang / b'a ti dang // ro yi shing rta shing gi gyad / 6 / ka bandha dang / byed ldan ni // mgo bo dang bral khog pa'o //
translated: The one with a corpse-seat, the one with a staff, the one with a corpse-chariot, the one with a tree-champion,🔽the one with a pillar, the one with a bird,🔽the one with a head-severed trunk.🔽

original: dur khrod dang ni pha mes nags //
analyzed: dur khrod dang ni pha mes nags //
translated: The cemetery, the cremation ground, the forest of the ancestors,

original: drag po rol ba zhi ba'i gnas //
analyzed: drag po rol ba zhi ba'i gnas //
translated: the place of the violent rite, the place of peace,

original: 'jig gnas bsreg gnas yi dags gnas //
analyzed: 'jig gnas bsreg gnas yi dags gnas //
translated: the place of the world, the place of the cremation, the place of the pretas,

original: ro tha ba sgong pu ga tsa ti dang // shing gi gnas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ro tha ba sgong pu ga tsa ti dang // shing gi gnas zhes bya ba'o //

analyzed: ri mos bkra dang mchod rten dang // rtag par ro khar byur bu'o //

original: legs byas bkur sti dam pa byed //
analyzed: legs byas bkur sti dam pa byed //
translated: the place of the good action, the place of the supreme worship,

original: mchog tu byed pa rnams yin no //
analyzed: mchog tu byed pa rnams yin no //

original: rab zung / nyer bzung /
analyzed: rab zung / nyer bzung /

analyzed: gzung bya dang // phyag byed pa dang ma ti'o //

analyzed: btson rar bcings pa'i khang pa dang // khri mon dang ni chad pa'i khyim //

original: shing gnas / shing khyim /
analyzed: shing gnas / shing khyim /
translated: the place of the tree, the place of the house of the tree,

original: chad can bcings //
analyzed: chad can bcings //
translated: the place of the condemned, the place of the bound.

original: skyes bu'i srog ni pr'a na'o //
analyzed: skyes bu'i srog ni pr'a na'o //
translated: The life of the person is the praṇa.

original: de bzhin 'tsho dang gson pa dang // tshe ni ji srid 'tsho ba'i dus //
analyzed: de bzhin 'tsho dang gson pa dang // tshe ni ji srid 'tsho ba'i dus //

analyzed: skyes bu 'tsho byed 'tsho ba'i sman //

original: dmag gi yan lag gi rab tu byed pa'o /
analyzed: dmag gi yan lag gi rab tu byed pa'o /
translated: This is the chapter on the branches of the army.

original: // / zhes pa snyan ngag mkhan po pandi ta dpal @144b ldan dpal 'dzin sde yis rnam par bkod pa sna tshogs gsal ba zhes bya ba ming gzhan mu teg phreng ba las rgyal rigs kyi sde rdzogs so /
analyzed: // / zhes pa snyan ngag mkhan po pandi ta dpal @144b ldan dpal 'dzin sde yis rnam par bkod pa sna tshogs gsal ba zhes bya ba ming gzhan mu teg phreng ba las rgyal rigs kyi sde rdzogs so /
translated: Thus, the chapter on the kṣatriya class is completed from the work called The Clear Elucidation of Various Compositions composed by the great poet and paṇḍita Śrīmati Śrīdhara.

original: // / barla byung /
analyzed: // / barla byung /

analyzed: barla skyes // dzoo dang // rje rigs sa 'dzin rje'u'o /

analyzed: 6 / kun 'tsho ba dang / 'tshe ba dang // son byed so nam 'tsho tshis so //

original: zhabs thog 'jug byed /
analyzed: zhabs thog 'jug byed /

analyzed: lta ba dang // bden par brjod dang zhing las dang // bden dang shi po nytsa dang ni ; / rmo rko dang ni phru rlog go / ma bslangs pa dang / aa mri ta //

original: bslangs pa dang ni mri ta'o //
analyzed: bslangs pa dang ni mri ta'o //

analyzed: pr'a mi tyi ni skyed kyis 'tsho //
translated: [The term] pramīti refers to what is given by the mother.🔽[The terms] ṛṇa, paryāya, bhoga, ādāna, and parivarta refer to debt.

analyzed: bu lon dang ni par++ya dang // bskyi ba dang ni g-yar ba dang // brde ba dang ni bsgyur brlog go / so sor sbyin dang rnam par brje //

original: nges pa yongs su 'jug pa dang // brje dang yongs 'jug cha gzhan dang // nor gyi rab tu sbyor ba dang // le lo can dang skyed kyis 'tsho //
analyzed: nges pa yongs su 'jug pa dang // brje dang yongs 'jug cha gzhan dang // nor gyi rab tu sbyor ba dang // le lo can dang skyed kyis 'tsho //

original: ma l'a kshi k'a ha zhes dang // ra ni dh'a ba bden mi bden //
analyzed: ma l'a kshi k'a ha zhes dang // ra ni dh'a ba bden mi bden //
translated: [The terms] mālakṣa, hā, and raṇidhāva refer to truth and untruth.

original: bi shan ni /
analyzed: bi shan ni /
translated: [The term] viśaṇa refers to

original: bu lon gtong //
analyzed: bu lon gtong //
translated: giving up debt.🔽[The terms] vṛddhi and dhana refer to

original: skyed pa dang ni nor spel ba //
analyzed: skyed pa dang ni nor spel ba //

original: 'dzin pa can dang sbyor ba pa //
analyzed: 'dzin pa can dang sbyor ba pa //

original: autta ma ni rab sbyor ba //
analyzed: autta ma ni rab sbyor ba //

original: spel ba spo dang spel bas 'tsho //
analyzed: spel ba spo dang spel bas 'tsho //

original: log min byed dang log 'tsho ba //
analyzed: log min byed dang log 'tsho ba //

original: legs pa dang ni nyis 'gyur ba //
analyzed: legs pa dang ni nyis 'gyur ba //

original: zhing pa shes pa so nam pa //
analyzed: zhing pa shes pa so nam pa //

original: phru rlog pa dang rmos pa dang // bram ze zhes pa 'di dag mtshungs //
analyzed: phru rlog pa dang rmos pa dang // bram ze zhes pa 'di dag mtshungs //

analyzed: rab rjeb dang nus ldan dang ; / shor ba pa dang 'khor lo skyong //
translated: (He who) is a good ploughman, (he who) is powerful, (he who) is a thief, (he who) is a wheel-protector,

original: zhing dang 'bru shas pa le yam //
analyzed: zhing dang 'bru shas pa le yam //

original: 'bru dang s'a lu 'byung ma'o //
analyzed: 'bru dang s'a lu 'byung ma'o //
translated: (He who) is a grain, (he who) is a rice, (he who) is a producer,

analyzed: nas dang nas zhing dug thu ba // nas sogs 'byung ba'i sa gzhi'o //

original: til zhing dang ni til skye ba //
analyzed: til zhing dang ni til skye ba //
translated: (He who) is a barley-producer, (he who) is a ground-producer,🔽(He who) is a sesame-field, (he who) is a sesame-producer,

original: aoo m'i ni dang sran ma skye //
analyzed: aoo m'i ni dang sran ma skye //
translated: (He who) is an O-ma-ni, (he who) is a pulse-producer,

original: sran ma can dang bhi g'i ta //
analyzed: sran ma can dang bhi g'i ta //

original: bcad bya gzhan lam rag pa'o //
analyzed: bcad bya gzhan lam rag pa'o //
translated: (He who) is to be cut, (he who) is a different path-possessor,

original: thog gnyis mon gyi khri tshe dang // sran sogs kye dang bzod pa'o //
analyzed: thog gnyis mon gyi khri tshe dang // sran sogs kye dang bzod pa'o //
translated: (He who) is a two-time-endurer, (he who) is a Mon-go-tri-tsa, (he who) is a pulse-endurer, and (he who) is a patience-endurer,

original: sa bon btsugs dang bskrun pa dang // btab dang rmos dang skyed pa'o //🔽gsum log dang ni lan gsum pa //
analyzed: sa bon btsugs dang bskrun pa dang // btab dang rmos dang skyed pa'o // gsum log dang ni lan gsum pa //
translated: (He who) is a seed-planter, (he who) is a producer, (he who) is a sown-one, (he who) is a ploughed-one, (he who) is a grown-one,🔽(He who) is a three-turner, (he who) is a three-timer,

original: gsum rlog gsum rmos de la yang //
analyzed: gsum rlog gsum rmos de la yang //
translated: (He who) is a three-turner, (he who) is a three-plougher, and (he who) is a three-ploughed-one, and also to him,

original: nyis 'gyur byas dang de bzhin du //
analyzed: nyis 'gyur byas dang de bzhin du //
translated: The words dviguṇa and tathā are used in the sense of double.

original: thams cad samb'a krita mo //🔽@145a * // bre dang bre bo che sogs tshad //🔽bre can bre bo che can sogs //
analyzed: thams cad samb'a krita mo // @145a * // bre dang bre bo che sogs tshad // bre can bre bo che can sogs //
translated: The word sarva is used in the sense of all.🔽The words bhāra, bhāradhara, and so on are used in the sense of measure.🔽The words bhāradhārin and bhāradhārakīya are used in the sense of having a measure.

original: b'a r'i tshad can kh'ar'i ka / ma rha marno dang pa'o //
analyzed: b'a r'i tshad can kh'ar'i ka / ma rha marno dang pa'o //
translated: The words vārāṇasī and kāśī are used in the sense of a measure of vāra.🔽The words kṣetra, bhūmi, dhānya, dhānyajāta, dhānyavāhinī, and dhānyavāhinī are used in the sense of a field, ground, grain, grain-producing, grain-bearing, and grain-bearing, respectively.

original: zhing dang sa gzhi 'bru skye dang // 'brums chu ma mu tshigs can //🔽rmo ba zhings sa gzhi tshogs //🔽bong ba dang ni sa sgong dang // ko ti ra dang ko ti dang // she loshta sogs dbye ba'o //🔽lcag pa dbyig pa to tri dang // pra dza na dang gzir byed do //
analyzed: zhing dang sa gzhi 'bru skye dang // 'brums chu ma mu tshigs can // rmo ba zhings sa gzhi tshogs // bong ba dang ni sa sgong dang // ko ti ra dang ko ti dang // she loshta sogs dbye ba'o // lcag pa dbyig pa to tri dang // pra dza na dang gzir byed do //
translated: The words kṣetrī, bhūmi, and dhānyavān are used in the sense of a field, ground, and grain, respectively.🔽The words pāmśu, bhūmi, bhūmi, goṭa, koṭi, koṭi, śe loṣṭa, and so on are used in the sense of a division.🔽The words kṣepa, daṇḍa, toṭaka, prajā, and abhibhū are used in the sense of a whip, stick, rod, people, and conqueror, respectively.

original: zor ba dang ni rnga byed do //🔽tog tse dang ni rko byed do //
analyzed: zor ba dang ni rnga byed do // tog tse dang ni rko byed do //
translated: The words kṣura and bherī are used in the sense of a razor and a drum, respectively.🔽The words pīṭha and kumbhī are used in the sense of a seat and a pot, respectively.🔽The words halī, laṅgī, and laṅgāla are used in the sense of a plow, plowshare, and plow, respectively.

original: gshol dang thong pa rmod byed dang // ri r'i sham dang langga la //🔽pha lam phung po can ha lam //
analyzed: gshol dang thong pa rmod byed dang // ri r'i sham dang langga la // pha lam phung po can ha lam //
translated: The words phala and phala are used in the sense of a heap and a mountain.

original: sa 'joms dang ni ku d'a la //
analyzed: sa 'joms dang ni ku d'a la //
translated: The words bhūmi and kumbhī are used in the sense of earth and a pot.

original: ma ni rnam par 'joms pa'o //
analyzed: ma ni rnam par 'joms pa'o //
translated: The word manī is used in the sense of a jewel.

original: gshol chen dzitpa ha l'i dang // s'a mya'o gnya' shing gnya' phur dang // gshol mda' gshol gyi dbyig pa'o //
analyzed: gshol chen dzitpa ha l'i dang // s'a mya'o gnya' shing gnya' phur dang // gshol mda' gshol gyi dbyig pa'o //
translated: The bridle is called varāha, and the reins are called varāha.

original: dor dang rmo glang bartta ti //🔽pags dang skul byed dam pa las //🔽srab dang 'dzin spyad ces pa yang //
analyzed: dor dang rmo glang bartta ti // pags dang skul byed dam pa las // srab dang 'dzin spyad ces pa yang //
translated: The post to which the plough animal is tied is called varāha.🔽The plough is called varāha, and the ploughshare is called varāha.

original: brtod phur dang ni 'dogs pa'i shing //
analyzed: brtod phur dang ni 'dogs pa'i shing //
translated: The goad is called varāha, and the ploughshare-tip is called varāha.🔽The ploughman is called varāha.🔽The skin is called varāha, and the whip is called varāha.🔽The bridle is called varāha, and the reins are called varāha.

original: gang du phyugs rnams 'ching ba'o //
analyzed: gang du phyugs rnams 'ching ba'o //
translated: The post to which the plough animal is tied is called varāha.🔽The plough is called varāha, and the ploughshare is called varāha.🔽The goad is called varāha, and the ploughshare-tip is called varāha.🔽The ploughman is called varāha.

original: kha l'a dha no kha la mtshungs //
analyzed: kha l'a dha no kha la mtshungs //
translated: The skin is called varāha, and the whip is called varāha.

original: rnga pa dang ni gcod pa'o //
analyzed: rnga pa dang ni gcod pa'o //
translated: The bridle is called varāha, and the reins are called varāha.

analyzed: pa r'i tra pa sa bon yin // 'bras dkar 'bru dang pa ta la //
translated: The post to which the plough animal is tied is called varāha.🔽The plough is called varāha, and the ploughshare is called varāha.

analyzed: 'bru dbye aanna sbi na dang // tshogs can bod kyi sran ma dang // ha ri nu dang khandi k'a //
translated: The goad is called varāha, and the ploughshare-tip is called varāha.🔽The ploughman is called varāha.

analyzed: pri lam ku dang khre rgod do // bkra shis dang ni sran chung dang / mon sran 'bru ser gre'u 'o //
translated: The skin is called varāha, and the whip is called varāha.🔽The bridle is called varāha, and the reins are called varāha.🔽The post to which the plough animal is tied is called varāha.🔽The plough is called varāha, and the ploughshare is called varāha.

original: gro dang yid bzang kla klo'i zas //
analyzed: gro dang yid bzang kla klo'i zas //
translated: The goad is called varāha, and the ploughshare-tip is called varāha.

original: rab sgrim zhes pa 'di dang go //
analyzed: rab sgrim zhes pa 'di dang go //
translated: The ploughman is called varāha.

original: bri ka dkar po ya tsa dag //
analyzed: bri ka dkar po ya tsa dag //
translated: The skin is called varāha, and the whip is called varāha.🔽The bridle is called varāha, and the reins are called varāha.🔽The post to which the plough animal is tied is called varāha.🔽The plough is

analyzed: mu ta nag po nags skye dang // dpyid skyes nags kyi mungga dang // mungga brkyang ba dag mtshungs te //

analyzed: til skyes dang ni dgos pa'i til //

analyzed: ske tshe / kshu dha mngon skyed dang // a'a shva r'i dang nag mo dang // ksha pa dang ni yungs kar rgyal //

analyzed: @145b ku lattha dang nges snum dang // zangs kyi gtsug phud kulla sha //

analyzed: zar ma au mukshu m'i'o //

analyzed: tsandi k'a ni /

analyzed: tsangga t'i // gam gesh'i zhes bya ba ni //

analyzed: sha ta sha rka r'a zhes so //

analyzed: lo thog rtse mo kam sha ru /

original: lo tog snye ma ka ne sham /
analyzed: lo tog snye ma ka ne sham /

analyzed: so ba 'bru dang skogs can dang // stamba gutstsha rtsva sogs 'bru //

original: za byed tsha ba'i 'joms pa ni //
analyzed: za byed tsha ba'i 'joms pa ni //

original: lo tog rnams kyi gcod byed do //
analyzed: lo tog rnams kyi gcod byed do //

original: mgul ba dar pa sdong bu dang // p'a la l'a dang 'bras bu med //🔽spun stong dang ni phub ma dang // skogs pa dang ni spun pa'o //
analyzed: mgul ba dar pa sdong bu dang // p'a la l'a dang 'bras bu med // spun stong dang ni phub ma dang // skogs pa dang ni spun pa'o //
translated: The swelling of the throat is Kāṇḍa. The stalk is Pala. The fruitless is Phala.

original: rtse mo dang ni gra ma dang // rno ba sha mi si mb'a'o //
analyzed: rtse mo dang ni gra ma dang // rno ba sha mi si mb'a'o //
translated: The thousand sprouts is Kaṇḍa. The chaff is Tuṣa. The husk is Kaṇṭaka. The sprout is Kaṇḍa.🔽The top is Kaṇṭaka. The grain is Kaṇṭaka. The sharp is Śaṃśa.

original: so ba'i tshogs pa dh'a n+ya yin //
analyzed: so ba'i tshogs pa dh'a n+ya yin //
translated: The group of twenty-year-olds is the Dānya.🔽Pure, and made in abundance,

original: btsang ba dang ni mang byas dang // sran ma la sogs gong bu'i 'bru //🔽snye ma'i 'bru ni nas la sogs //
analyzed: btsang ba dang ni mang byas dang // sran ma la sogs gong bu'i 'bru // snye ma'i 'bru ni nas la sogs //
translated: grains in a lump, such as beans, etc.🔽The grain of a panicle is barley, etc.

original: ka l'a la sogs s'a la rnams //
analyzed: ka l'a la sogs s'a la rnams //
translated: The sālas, such as the kalahaṃsa, etc.,

original: drug cu pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: drug cu pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: are the ṣaṣṭika, etc.

original: ga pe // bgrod dka' //
analyzed: ga pe // bgrod dka' //
translated: Gaṅpā, difficult to traverse.

original: be dhu k'a //
analyzed: be dhu k'a //
translated: Vedhakāra.

original: rgya che'i rtsa dang dgu lunytsu //
analyzed: rgya che'i rtsa dang dgu lunytsu //

original: zegs ma phra mo t'anda la //
analyzed: zegs ma phra mo t'anda la //

original: lcags rtse dang ni gtun shing dang // gtun dang au b'u sha la'o //
analyzed: lcags rtse dang ni gtun shing dang // gtun dang au b'u sha la'o //
translated: The iron point, the mortar, the pestle, and the ubbhāṣa.

original: kanda ra dang b'a d'i ra //
analyzed: kanda ra dang b'a d'i ra //
translated: The kaṇḍara and the vāḍīra.

original: tshogs se dang ni khrol ma'o //
analyzed: tshogs se dang ni khrol ma'o //
translated: The group is the seka, and the bag is the kholma.

original: blo ma dang ni 'khrab byed do //🔽khres dang thum bu sgye pa tshe //
analyzed: blo ma dang ni 'khrab byed do // khres dang thum bu sgye pa tshe //
translated: The mind is the loma, and the one who spreads is the ācārya.

original: rtsva khres ka linda ka dang // sbyangs dang nges sbyangs 'bru'i bdab //
analyzed: rtsva khres ka linda ka dang // sbyangs dang nges sbyangs 'bru'i bdab //
translated: The bundle, the packet, and the bag are the kaṭi, the kalinda, and the śāka.

original: ku shul ka / aushtam k'a / lus ldan snod dang pingga nam //
analyzed: ku shul ka / aushtam k'a / lus ldan snod dang pingga nam //

original: ri mo mkhan las byung ba'o //
analyzed: ri mo mkhan las byung ba'o //
translated: The son of the Brahmin and the artist is the Ugra.

original: gtum po'i skye bar gyur pa ni //🔽bram ze mo dang chos bsgrub las //
analyzed: gtum po'i skye bar gyur pa ni // bram ze mo dang chos bsgrub las //
translated: The son of the Brahmin and the ascetic woman is the Caṇḍāla.🔽The son of the Brahmin and the woman who recites the Veda is the Pāraśara.

original: yi ge pa dang bka' 'grel byed //🔽rtsegs pa rigs dang glegs bam rigs //🔽byed mkhan dang ni bzo mo mkhan //
analyzed: yi ge pa dang bka' 'grel byed // rtsegs pa rigs dang glegs bam rigs // byed mkhan dang ni bzo mo mkhan //
translated: The son of the Brahmin and the woman who writes is the Vaiyākaraṇa.🔽The son of the Brahmin and the woman of the artisan caste is the Sūta.🔽The son of the Brahmin and the woman of the artist caste is the Māgadha.🔽The son of the Brahmin and the woman of the painter caste is the Āyogava.

original: ri mo'i las byed sgyu rtsal rigs //🔽rang bzhin @151a * //
analyzed: ri mo'i las byed sgyu rtsal rigs // rang bzhin @151a * //
translated: The son of the Brahmin and the woman of the dancer caste is the Caṇḍāla.

original: gyis ni shas nyan can //🔽blo gros can dang bzo bo'i rigs //
analyzed: gyis ni shas nyan can // blo gros can dang bzo bo'i rigs //
translated: The son of the Brahmin and the woman of the musician caste is the Pāraśara.🔽The son of the Brahmin and the woman of the prostitute caste is the Vaiyākaraṇa.

original: rigs ldan dang ni rigs kyi gtso //
analyzed: rigs ldan dang ni rigs kyi gtso //
translated: The son of the Brahmin and the woman of the washerman caste is the Sūta.

original: grong brtsegs pa dang chen po'o //🔽phreng rgyud mkhan dang me tog gcod //
analyzed: grong brtsegs pa dang chen po'o // phreng rgyud mkhan dang me tog gcod //
translated: The son of the Brahmin and the woman of the barber caste is the Māgadha.🔽The son of the Brahmin and the woman of the weaver caste is the Āyogava.

original: me tog gis 'tsho me tog can //
analyzed: me tog gis 'tsho me tog can //
translated: The son of the Brahmin and the woman of the garland maker caste is the Caṇḍāla.

original: de la me tog ya b'a sh'i //
analyzed: de la me tog ya b'a sh'i //
translated: The son of the Brahmin and the woman of the flower plucker caste is the Pāraśara.🔽The son of the Brahmin and the woman of the flower seller caste is the Vaiyākaraṇa.🔽The son of the Brahmin and the woman of the flower plucker caste is the Āyogava.

original: me tog gcod ma nags mdzes ma //
analyzed: me tog gcod ma nags mdzes ma //
translated: The son of the Brahmin and the woman of the flower plucker caste is the Caṇḍāla.

original: pushpa m'a bhri phreng ldan ma //
analyzed: pushpa m'a bhri phreng ldan ma //
translated: The son of the Brahmin and the woman of the flower plucker caste is the Pāraśara.🔽The son of the Brahmin and the woman of the flower plucker caste is the Vaiyākaraṇa.🔽The son of the Brahmin and the woman of the flower plucker caste is the Āyogava.🔽The son of the Brahmin and the woman of the flower plucker caste is the Caṇḍāla.🔽The son of the Brahmin and the woman of the flower plucker caste is

original: me tog rab tu sog byed ma'o //
analyzed: me tog rab tu sog byed ma'o //
translated: The flower-maker, and so on.

original: rdza mkhan dang ni bum pa mkhan //
analyzed: rdza mkhan dang ni bum pa mkhan //
translated: The potter and the pot maker,

original: 'khor los 'tsho dang sa las byed //
analyzed: 'khor los 'tsho dang sa las byed //

original: dbyug gu bsgyur ba zhes pa'o //
analyzed: dbyug gu bsgyur ba zhes pa'o //
translated: The one who wields a staff.🔽The plasterer, the lapaka,🔽The one who lives on water, the one who lives on air,

original: zhal ba mkhan po la pa ka / pra dhas 'tsho dang tstsha dh'a dang // su dha susta phyugs sogs las //
analyzed: zhal ba mkhan po la pa ka / pra dhas 'tsho dang tstsha dh'a dang // su dha susta phyugs sogs las //
translated: The one who lives on milk, the one who lives on grass, and so on.

original: tanta ba ya thags mkhan no //
analyzed: tanta ba ya thags mkhan no //
translated: The weaver, the tailor,
